010package imagingbook.lib.util;
011
012import java.io.File;
013import java.io.FileOutputStream;
014import java.io.IOException;
015import java.io.InputStream;
016import java.net.URI;
017import java.net.URISyntaxException;
018import java.net.URL;
019import java.net.URLClassLoader;
020import java.util.jar.Manifest;
021
022import javax.swing.JFileChooser;
023import javax.swing.LookAndFeel;
024import javax.swing.UIManager;
025
026
027/**
028 * This class defines various static methods for managing
029 * file-based resources and JAR manifest files.
030 * 
031 * @author W. Burger
032 */
033public abstract class FileUtils {
034
035        /**
036         * Removes the extension part of a pathname.
037         * Examples:<br>
038         * "foo.txt" &rarr; "foo",
039         * "foo" &rarr; "foo",
040         * "foo." &rarr; "foo.",
041         * ".txt" &rarr; ".txt".
042         * @param name the pathname
043         * @return the pathname without the extension (if valid)
044         */
045        public static String stripFileExtension(String name) {
046                int dotInd = name.lastIndexOf('.');
047                // if dot is in the first position,
048                // we are dealing with a hidden file rather than an DefaultFileExtension
049                return (dotInd > 0) ? name.substring(0, dotInd) : name;
050        }
051        
052        /**
053         * Extracts the extension part of a pathname as a string.
054         * Examples:<br>
055         * "foo.txt" &rarr; "txt",
056         * "foo" &rarr; "",
057         * "foo." &rarr; "",
058         * ".txt" &rarr; "".
059         * @param name the pathname
060         * @return the extension or an empty string
061         */
062        public static String getFileExtension(String name) {
063                int dotInd = name.lastIndexOf('.');
064                return (dotInd > 0) ? name.substring(dotInd + 1) : "";
065        }
066        
067        // ----  resources-related stuff ----------------------------------
068        
069        /**
070         * Find the path from which a given class was loaded.
071         * @param clazz a class.
072         * @return the path of the .class file for the given class or null (e.g.
073         * if the class is anonymous).
074         */
075        public static String getClassPath(Class<?> clazz) {
076                String path = null;
077                try {
078                        URI uri = clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toURI();
079                        if (uri != null && !uri.getPath().isEmpty()) {
080                                path = new File(uri).getCanonicalPath();
081                        }
082                } catch (URISyntaxException | IOException e) { }
083                return path;
084        }
085        
086//      public static String getClassPath(Class<?> clazz) {
087//              return clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().getFile();
088//              //return clazz.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation().toString();
089//      }
090        
091        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
092
093        /**
094         * Lists (to System.out) the paths where classes are loaded from.
095         */
096        public static void printClassPath() {
097                ClassLoader cl = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
098                URL[] urls = ((URLClassLoader) cl).getURLs();
099                for (URL url : urls) {
100                        System.out.println(url.getPath());
101                }
102        }
103        
104        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
105        
106        /**
107         * Checks 'by name' if a particular class exists.
108         * 
109         * @param classname fully qualified name of the class, e.g. {@literal imagingbook.lib.util.FileUtils}
110         * @return {@code true} if the class was found, {@code false} otherwise
111         */
112        public static boolean checkClass(String classname) {
113                // String logStr = "  checking class " + classname + " ... ";
114                try {
115                        if (Class.forName(classname) != null) {
116                                // IJ.log(logStr + "OK");
117                                return true;
118                        }
119                } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) { }
120                // IJ.log(logStr + "ERROR");
121                return false;
122        }
123        
124        
125        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
126        
127        // from https://bukkit.org/threads/extracting-file-from-jar.16962/
128        /**
129         * Reads all data from the given input stream and copies them
130         * to to a file.
131         * @param in the input stream
132         * @param file the output file
133         * @throws IOException if anything goes wrong
134         */
135        public static void copyToFile(InputStream in, File file) throws IOException {
136                FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(file);
137                try {
138                        byte[] buf = new byte[1024];
139                        int i = 0;
140                        while ((i = in.read(buf)) != -1) {
141                                out.write(buf, 0, i);
142                        }
143                } catch (IOException e) {
144                        throw e;
145                } finally {
146                        if (in != null) {
147                                in.close();
148                        }
149                        if (out != null) {
150                                out.close();
151                        }
152                }
153        }
154        
155        
156        
157        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
158        
159        /**
160         * Finds the manifest (from META-INF/MANIFEST.MF) of the JAR file
161         * from which {@literal clazz} was loaded.
162         * 
163         * See: http://stackoverflow.com/a/1273432
164         * @param clazz A class in the JAR file of interest.
165         * @return A {@link Manifest} object or {@literal null} if {@literal clazz}
166         * was not loaded from a JAR file.
167         */
168        public static Manifest getJarManifest(Class<?> clazz) {
169                String className = clazz.getSimpleName() + ".class";            
170                String classPath = clazz.getResource(className).toString();
171                //IJ.log("classPath = " + classPath);
172                if (!classPath.startsWith("jar")) { // Class not from JAR
173                  return null;
174                }
175                String manifestPath = classPath.substring(0, classPath.lastIndexOf("!") + 1) + "/META-INF/MANIFEST.MF";
176                Manifest manifest = null;
177                try {
178                        manifest = new Manifest(new URL(manifestPath).openStream());
179                } catch (IOException ignore) { }
180                return manifest;
181        }
182        
183        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
184        
185        
186        /**
187         * Opens a dialog for the user to select a single folder (no files).
188         * Contained files and sub-folders are shown.
189         * Uses native (system) look-and-feel; original look-and-feel is restored.
190         * 
191         * @param startDirectory the directory to start from (pass {@code ""} or {@code "."} for the current directory)
192         * @param dialogTitle the string shown in the title bar of the dialog window
193         * @return a {@link File} object representing the selected directory or {@code null} if the dialog was canceled 
194         */
195        public static File selectFolder(String startDirectory, String dialogTitle) {
196                File startDir = new File(startDirectory);
197                if (!startDir.exists()) {
198                        startDir = new File(".");
199                }
200                
201                JFileChooser chooser = null;
202                LookAndFeel laf = UIManager.getLookAndFeel();   // get current look-and-feel
203
204                try { 
205                        UIManager.setLookAndFeel(UIManager.getSystemLookAndFeelClassName()); // use native look and feel
206                        chooser = new JFileChooser(startDir) {
207                                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
208                                public void approveSelection() {
209                                        if (getSelectedFile().isFile()) {
210                                                return;
211                                        } else {
212                                                super.approveSelection();
213                                        }
214                                } 
215                        };
216                        UIManager.setLookAndFeel(laf);  // reset look-and-feel
217                } 
218                catch (Exception e) { }
219                
220                if (chooser == null)
221                        return null;
222                
223                chooser.setDialogTitle(dialogTitle);
224                chooser.setFileSelectionMode(JFileChooser.FILES_AND_DIRECTORIES);
225                chooser.setAcceptAllFileFilterUsed(true);
226                chooser.setMultiSelectionEnabled(false);
227                chooser.setSelectedFile(new File(".")); // see https://stackoverflow.com/a/48316113
228
229                if (chooser.showOpenDialog(null) == JFileChooser.APPROVE_OPTION) {
230                        File selected = chooser.getSelectedFile();
231                        if (selected == null)
232                                throw new RuntimeException("selected directory is null");
233                        return selected;
234                }
235                else {  // dialog was canceled
236                        return null;
237                }
238        }
239        
240        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
241        
242        private static final String CurrentDirectoryKey = "imagingbook#currentdir";
243        
244        /**
245         * Sets a system property to memorize the current directory.
246         * Use {@link #getCurrentDirectory()} to retrieve this value.
247         * If the specified pathname is not a directory (i.e., a plain file), 
248         * its parent directory is used.
249         * 
250         * @param pathname a directory of file path
251         */
252        public static void setCurrentDirectory(String pathname) {
253                File file = new File(pathname);
254                String dir = (file.isDirectory()) ? file.toString() : file.getParent();
255                System.setProperty(CurrentDirectoryKey, dir);
256        }
257        
258        /**
259         * Returns the current directory path. 
260         * If the directory was set with {@link #setCurrentDirectory(String)} before
261         * this path is returned,
262         * otherwise the value for the "user.dir" system property.
263         * 
264         * @return a string with the current directory path
265         */
266        public static String getCurrentDirectory() {
267                String dir = System.getProperty(CurrentDirectoryKey);
268                return (dir != null) ? dir : System.getProperty("user.dir");
269        }
270        
271        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
272                        
273        public static void main(String[] args) {
274//              String fileName = ".txt";
275//              System.out.println("name = " + fileName);
276//              System.out.println("stripped = " + stripFileExtension(fileName));
277//              System.out.println("ext = " + getFileExtension(fileName));
278//              System.out.println(getClassPath(FileUtils.class));
279                
280                System.out.println("dir = " + getCurrentDirectory());
281                setCurrentDirectory("C:/tmp");
282                System.out.println("dir = " + getCurrentDirectory());
283        }
